Threats: Compromised server and services avilability
Single targeted actors are denied access to services
Compromised trust chain, impossibility to establish trust between parties
Incompatible IdMs and regulations compromise interoperability and service accessibility
Data is not portable and siloed, bound to specific systems
Denied access to governmental resources, healthcare, and social security
References: CHRSJ Paving road, CHRSJ chased away

Threats: Denied ability to exercise individual rights
Violation of the right to nationality and identity, stripping of nationality or creating barriers to it, statelessness
Discrimination
Interference with political lifecycle, election interference
IdM is released without appropriate verification and validation
Exacerbate Inequalities
Description: I am very undecided about this one, bc its origin is definitely design, but it sounds like a big threat towards users. Still it fits the definition of Issue

Data attributes contain malicious data
Private key disclosure, theft, acquisition
Unauthorized access to user agent device
Destruction of user agent device, causing damages to property and denial of service
Insider threat
Non-compliance and malpractice of employees
Non-compliance with laws, agreements, contracts, standards

Description: Referring to laws and regulations (different from standards)

Threats: User has not provided consent previous to data collection, processing, sharing

Threats: Function Creep, adding functions to the system with legally grey capabilities, after the users have agreed to the terms of a previous IdM version
Broken, bypassed verification of data and protocol artifacts
Data corruption, unauthorized data modification and deletion
Broken access control
Storage and association with inaccurate or wrong data
Unauthorized data retention
Percistency of user data in logs over the necessary retention time
Impossibility of completely deleting user data from system
Lack of auditability
Intelligence Gathering, additional information can be extracted from the system without the user or system knowledge
Insecure facial recognition authetication
Data creep and excessive demand for attributes (overcollection), request of unnecessary data
Loss or lack of control over identity data
Data shared with unvetted or malicious parties
Infrastructure Mismanagement leads to economic loss (hinders sustainability, maintainability; was originally economic risk)
Description: The IdM might be a catastrophic loss for the implementor (Government in case of Helperin 2012)

Threats: Vendor lock-in
